programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A little boy has a stone up his nose from playing football. A 92-year-old has had a fall by her car. And World War II hero Norman is 95 and has a dangerously low heart rate.

programme.title: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
programme.desc: A young girl named Sophie invites an anthropomorphised tiger over for an intimate tea party. He proceeds to drink all the tea and eat all the food.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This weeks competition comes from in and around Essex, and first to host is Natalie hopes that some tried and tested dishes and a decent dose of banter will wow her competition.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week comes from Essex, and second to host is bridal shop owner Alison. No-nonsense Alisons confident her minimum effort and maximum taste menu will be sure to bag her the £1000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This weeks competition is in Essex and dentist Amarinder hosts. Amarinder is feeling upbeat about his Bollywood themed evening and hopes that the flavours will be enough to propel him into top spot.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the fourth day in Essex, and child talent agency owner Donia has chosen an Egyptian themed evening to reflect her heritage. Is the food fit for a pharaoh or a dinner party disaster?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the final day of the competition and the turn of fish salesman Dean to host. He firmly believes his restaurant style menu will bag him the grand but will he end up a fish out of water?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Manor House Hotel in Haltwhistle, Northumberland, run by Terry and Rachel. Guests Tony and Paula are immediately enamoured of the honeymoon suite. But one BandBer has a headboard headache.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers embrace the great outdoors at Orchard Glamping in Garstang, Lancashire. Hosts Tom and Becky hope their pristine pods are pitch perfect. But theres one unhappy camper in their midst.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tony and Paula host the weeks third visit at Hotel Ellenby in Scarborough, where they reckon stunning sea views and local history will be a winning combination. The breakfast, not so much.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks final visit is to The Crown Inn in Derbyshire, where Dean and Abigail take great pride in their pub. A visit to an old mill proves to be inexplicably popular, but traffic noise gives some of the guests a restless night.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its payment day, and theres a smorgasbord of slanderous sleep scores, brutal breakfast bombshells and even one couple declining the opportunity to face their competitors. After all that contention, its time to find out whos won.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: In Rushden, Susan and John are torn over their unique character home. Kirstie has not one, but two plans up her sleeve to help avoid losing any of the charm that makes the five-bed house so special.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil are in Surrey, one of the UKs most expensive counties. Kirstie assists Lauren in Guildford, while Phil helps Eleanor and Laurence find the good life in Surbiton.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander is house hunting with John and Debbie around the Mar Menor on the Costa Calida in south-east Spain. The couple want a two-bedroom holiday home thats near the beach. They have a budget of £80,000 to buy an apartment or a townhouse.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Barbara and Butch are searching for the perfect holiday home in Lucca, Italy, for their £90k. Ben Hillman shows them five fantastic options, but will any make them want to Lucc-again?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sharon and Brendon want to buy a holiday home beside beautiful Lake Garda, but they each have very different priorities... Can Lucy Alexander fulfil their dreams?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rachel and Robin dream of buying a holiday home in Alicantes Jalon Valley, with the hope of relocating there in the future. Can Ben Hillman find their perfect place for £250k?

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall at Christmas
programme.desc: A festive visit to the residents of the beautiful south west at this busy time of year, from Christmas trees on The Lizard to lobsters, surfing and cider in Newquay.

programme.desc: A cyclist allegedly mistakes a deputy for a thief and tries to escape into the bushes. Police cut a dad some slack by not towing the family car. Two sisters catch the polices attention when they take their spat to the road.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: Alicia faces off against the US Treasury Department when she defends Dylan Stack, a lawyer who represents the creator of Bitcoin, an online currency with mysterious origins. Stack is being pressured to reveal the name of the anonymous Bitcoin creator so that the government can prosecute him for creating a currency that is in direct competition with the US dollar.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: A grand jury has been selected and it appears to be a foregone conclusion that Will Gardner will be indicted for bribing a judge. As the staff at Lockhart and Gardner prepare for the worst, Alicia learns how bad things have become for the first time. Elis feud with David Lee continues when he discovers Caitlins connection to his nemesis and decides to bury her under a mountain of meaningless clerical work.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: Lockhart and Gardner represents the families of three Americans who were detained and killed by the Syrian government during the uprising. They claim this happened because a technology company violated US law by knowingly selling software to Syria. Meanwhile, staff at the firm are exuberant following the grand jurys decision not to indict Will, but the mood changes when it is revealed that the Bar has been tipped off.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Engagement Picture

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Nap Partners

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Rosss Library Book

programme.title: 22 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: Jake and Chloes relationship reaches crisis point over Jake not pulling his weight as a dad and partner. When Chloe moves out, is this really the end for the young couple?

programme.title: 22 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: A clash of parenting means we see the parents of Britains biggest family do something they never do - argue! - as Good Cop Noel and Bad Cop Sue battle to control their brood.

programme.title: 22 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: The Radfords are back! Excitement builds in Morecambe as Noel and Sue prepare to move to their dream home, and Casper lands a prestigious Premier League trial. Can he make the grade?

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The cops deal with a major drugs bust in North Yorkshire, a wanted man linked to an alleged assault on a woman, and a gang of suspected poachers who are caught driving an untaxed van.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, cops look out for criminals and illegal drivers moving around under the cover of darkness. After a spike in catalytic converter thefts, a stinger is used to catch some thieves.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Over a Bank Holiday, near Scarborough, a high-speed pursuit ensues after a driver fails to stop. In the Dales, an operation is underway to crack down on motorists flouting the law.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A white van man makes a break for it after ploughing into a parked car, a suspect is not keen on wearing a set of cuffs, and the driver of a stolen car is brought to a halt thanks to some railings.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The interceptors chase down two separate runaways using wildly different tactics. Plus, dog handler Duncan assists armed response officers in Leeds city centre following reports of a man with a pistol.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Spenner are in pursuit of a driver who is so drunk that he cant even keep his car on the road and the chase ends with shocking results. Elsewhere, dog handler Tony comes across an unusual sight - a naked man stranded at the side of the road.

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: Entertainment programme.

programme.title: AandE After Dark
programme.desc: A woman is rushed in after her motorbike collided with a deer. Strongman Adam is devastated when an accident in the gym means he may not be able to compete in Hulls strongest man.

programme.title: AandE: Crash Scene Emergency
programme.desc: At Silverstone, professional MotoGP rider Taiga is involved in a four bike, high-speed pile up. And Andrei hit another vehicle, causing his car to veer into the central reservation.

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: After a woman suffers cardiac arrest while driving, paramedics must induce a coma at the roadside to save her. Meanwhile, a 19-year-old suffers critical injuries in a motorcycle crash.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: Alicia defends a documentary film-maker who is accused of being responsible for the suicide of a college student while making a movie about people who kill themselves. During the case, she must square up to her old nemesis Nancy Crozier and ask Caitlin to win over the judge and jury once again. As Will serves out his suspension at home, the power vacuum at Lockhart and Gardner draws the attention of Eli, Julius and David Lee.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: After being released from prison, Lockhart and Gardner client Colin Sweeney attempts to convince the shareholders of his former company to vote him back in as CEO. At the last moment, however, a former employee accuses Sweeney of sexually harassing her and fathering her baby. Alicia has just 72 hours to prove that the allegations are false before Sweeney is forced out of his company for good.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: Lockhart and Gardner represents a client who suffered severe injuries and lost his wife when a snowmobile malfunctioned and struck a tree. However, Alicia and her legal team are opposed by the firms nemesis, Louis Canning, who never gives in without a fight. Elsewhere, unable to raise enough money to make a down payment on her old house, Alicia starts to take Cannings offers of a lucrative job much more seriously.

programme.desc: Shane who runs his own pool-side bar in Torremolinos and hosts his biggest-ever event: a wedding for over 200 guests but its critical the bar rakes in 4k.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Singer Laura-Elen has a trial gig at a Fuengirola bar, determined to secure a regular slot to add to her wedding fund. Bambi reveals her rural lifestyle.

programme.title: Filthy Britain SOS
programme.desc: Ex-military man Andreas is the perfect fit to catch a brazen dump-and-run fly tipper in Harrow, while Buckinghamshires waste warriors take a stand against criminal fly-tippers. In Oxford, the results of drivers caught short have to be removed.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The cops seek to protect a collection of the most vulnerable members of society including a suicidal young man with mental health problems, an Eritrean woman dumped out of a lorry by people traffickers, and a local lass whos had a barney with her two-timing boyfriend.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The cops are cracking down on car thieves. Their hunt for a stolen car ends in a dramatic foot chase. Two reckless high performance car thieves lead them on the longest pursuit in the history of the force.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The cops have their hands full with night time drink driving incidents. Four police cars are needed to stop a car with a motorbike hanging out of the boot.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Profiling the work of high-speed police interception units around the country with some of the most dangerous pursuits and shocking footage ever captured. Exploring what it takes to bring order to chaos.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: When a dog handler is taken out of the chase, multiple cops and the police chopper take up the hunt for a driver who flees on foot.

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: 22 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: Noel is acting very strangely, turning his back on work and family. Maybe a move to Australia be the tonic he needs. Plus, Lukes relationship with sister Chloe comes under strain.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Kahn needs all his bedside manner skills to help a girl with situs invertus, a condition that causes her internal organs to be reversed. Teenage mum Olivia brings along great-grandmother Linda, who is eager to make sure it does not happen again.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: 8-year-old Marcus suffers with ADHD, a condition which places great strain on the sufferer and their loved ones.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Sister Benita has just clocked onto her shift in resus and already every bay is taken up with critically ill patients. However, the team must make room as another emergency is being rushed in.

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to help a 67-year-old HGV driver who has suffered a cardiac arrest, and, in Hillingdon, a man who has suffered severe burns after lighting a bonfire with petrol.

programme.title: 999 Critical Condition
programme.desc: John has been stabbed numerous times and is rushed straight for emergency surgery. Teen footballer Adam has lost all sensation below his waist. Kevin was knocked unconscious by a cows hoof on the dairy farm where he works.

programme.title: Trauma Room One
programme.desc: A man arrives in theatre with agonising back pain and doctors suspect a cancerous tumour is compressing his spinal cord. He needs an urgent operation using a hi-tech robot to remove it.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: William arrives with intense knee pain, Lucas returns with his mum after a football accident, Edward has a suspected heart murmur and Doris opens up about needing companionship.

programme.title: The Good Wife
programme.desc: An overworked Diane delegates one of her responsibilities - a seat on a blue ribbon panel investigating alleged police misconduct - to Alicia. The case involves a police officer who shot and killed a man on a subway platform. Alicia begins to suspect that the other members of the panel are unwilling to get to the bottom of what actually happened. She then must tackle some of the most influential judges and politicians.

programme.title: The Good Wife

Alicia has just 72 hours to prove that the allegations are false before Sweeney is forced out of his company for good.

programme.title: An Evening With Sammy Davis Jr
programme.desc: A compilation of the very best of Sammy Davis Jrs famous 1960s performances for the BBC, that leaves no doubt as to why at the time he was billed as the Worlds Greatest Living Entertainer.

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Blencathra
programme.desc: Terry Abraham returns to the Lake District to showcase `the peoples mountain, Blencathra. It looks at the lives of local residents, school children and visitors to the mountain with contributions from celebrities.

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts reveals the natural history of the Ice Ages woolly mammoth. Mammoths have transfixed humans since the depths of the last Ice Age when their herds roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Although extinct for thousands of years, scientists can now paint an incredibly detailed picture of their lives thanks to whole carcasses beautifully preserved in the Siberian permafrost.

programme.title: The Truth About Christmas Carols
programme.desc: There could be nothing more sweet and sentimental than the sound of traditional carols performed by a velvet-voiced choir at Christmas, or so you would think. Composer Howard Goodall uncovers the surprising and often secret history of the Christmas carol. Far from being accepted as part of the celebrations of Jesus birth, over the centuries carols have been banned by both church and state.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: At Longleat Safari Park, the keepers are working hard to get the animals ready for winter. Joy spreads across the park as the keepers welcome some early Christmas presents - lots of new arrivals from afar, including furry binturongs, cute fennec foxes, adorable dik diks and some jumpy ostriches. Kate and Ben follow their first steps into the park as the keepers nervously mix them with the current residents. And will a long-term cheetah romance come good at Christmas?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A house in Hednesford in Staffordshire, and two retail spaces in Norwich and Weymouth are bought at online auctions by developers who all see the bricks and mortar as investments. All three projects take longer, or cost more than originally planned, but the investors reckon they will still turn a profit.

programme.desc: Roo Irvine learns about the long history of salmon fishing on the River Tweed. The teams shop in Kelso, but will the bidders take the bait at Paul Laidlaws auction in Carlisle?

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Brazils favelas are considered extremely dangerous, making them one of the worlds most deadly places to grow up. As a result of poverty and a lack of government and police control, many young men here resort to drug dealing and gang crime under the control of the drug cartels. In other neighbourhoods, heavily armed criminal militia groups control day-to-day life with an iron grip, extorting residents - fail to pay or cross them, and the consequences can be deadly.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe confides in Lauren, George makes an effort to forgive, and Billy is given a mission by Lexi.

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity: a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi, and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to.

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mum out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Its an American special as Jeremy, Richard and James try to prove that a fly-drive holiday to Florida would be more fun if you bought a car instead of renting one. Having picked up some wheels for no more than $1,000 each, the boys embark on an epic road trip to find out who got the best deal, encountering heat, flies and very angry locals along the way.

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed forever and misses Sadie. Malcolms babysitting night in is upturned by Derek, who ropes Malcolm into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, whilst keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early.

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm takes Gemma and Sadie on a weekend break. When Malcolms estranged dad, Jackie, invites himself along, Malcolm calls Derek for support but soon discovers his secret addiction.

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: South Africa has for years battled the scourge of rhino poaching, fuelled by insatiable demand for their horns in Asia. Ashley embarks on a mission to find out who is behind these brutal acts, discovering how the challenges young men face growing up in deprived rural communities can lead to illegal poaching. Hanging out with men from KwaZulu-Natal - or Zululand - he earns their trust and joins them on a legal hunt for bushmeat in order to understand what day-to-day life is like here.

programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead work together to give new life to run-down classic automobiles to resell them at a profit. Working on a tight budget, Mike must find a vehicle for Ant to fix, but that isnt always the easiest task.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer, along with a trusted mechanic, is on a mission to find and restore iconic cars to sell for a profit.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: A Colorado war veterans family and stable of horses are ravaged by hurricane-force winds that make subsistence all but impossible. But when the Raneys learn of their larger dream, they pull out the stops with some of their most creative builds yet.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Oregon homesteaders find their dream in jeopardy following a near-fatal accident; the Raneys face a daunting rescue where a dilapidated bridge has cut them off from their land, and strict building regulations force them to get creative.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys enter the shadow of Mount Denali to tackle their first-ever dual homestead rescue. Marty, Misty and Matt race against the clock to address food, water and shelter concerns that could ensure both homesteads survive the next brutal winter.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In South Wales, an abandoned convent is demolished. Plus, in Lancashire copper products are recycled and in Yorkshire an artist uses scrap for his latest project.

programme.title: Moonshiners: Master Distiller
programme.desc: Three firefighters famous for their shine compete to run their best off-duty recipes; veteran firemen Tim and Mark taste the results and, along with Digger, pay tribute to the history between the brotherhoods of firefighting and moonshining.

programme.title: Moonshiners: Master Distiller
programme.desc: Mark, Digger and Tim taste the results as two outlaw shiners and a legal distiller take on record high prices in a competition to see who can make the best run of shine on a $30 budget. Only one will take home the title of Master Distiller.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Black Dog crew salvage the Robert E. Lee Hotel, a luxury hotel build in 1926.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Black Dog crew works on salvaging a grist mill.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: Mike and Elvis are going global! This time, the stakes are higher, the deadlines tighter and the motor transformations are more jaw-dropping than ever.

programme.title: Wild and Weird America
programme.desc: Outrageous clips of near-miss car crashes, avalanche disasters and a terrifying, death-defying glider ride.

programme.title: Wild and Weird America
programme.desc: Amateurs attempt outrageous activities as they showcase backyard engineering, clueless humans and uncooperative machinery.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Marty re-rescues the Broadhead family, whose Ohio home was made from 30,000 tires and faces major new structural issues. Taking on a big challenge with limited time, Marty must restore a settling berm and construct a concrete storm.

programme.title: Expedition X
programme.desc: Josh and Heather continue their investigation into the horrific history of Spike Island. Their search uncovers the home of a notorious madman known as Dr. Death and leads them into terrifying tunnels lurking beneath the sprawling paranormal prison.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: A Big Island family finds their off-grid paradise threatened by destructive storms and deadly pests; to save them, the Raneys must get creative.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Raney Returns: Back to Black Hills
programme.desc: Homesteading has exploded in popularity, with families moving to more remote areas and with bigger ambition than ever before. But for the rookie off-gridder striving for self-sufficiency, extreme plans often lead to extreme problems.

programme.title: Gold Rush: Dave Turins Lost Mine
programme.desc: Families from across America reach out to quarry and mining expert, Dave Turin. He helps to resurrect failing mines, so the owners can search for gold again!

programme.title: Gold Rush: Dave Turins Lost Mine
programme.desc: The team divides in the remote Idaho Rockies; already behind schedule, Dave is forced to make a bet that can make or break the season.

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun. Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine, and Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the clients mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crews mettle.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: As the fleet mounts a final Winter season push, sad news rattles the Cornelia Marie wheelhouse. Lady Alaska greenhorn, Gabby, overcomes a painful injury to support her crew. Wild Bills deckhands must devise a bush fix or face hauling pots by hand.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Saga loses a veteran deckhand, forcing Jake to steam a greenhorn army to the Russian line. Amid scuttlebutt that ports are closing due to a virus, Josh fights to get home for a reunion with his brother and Sigs daughter gets rushed to the hospital.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.sub-title: Salvaging Items in Norfolk and Petersburg Into Repurposed Goods
programme.desc: The Black Dog Salvage crew splits up for the week. Robert and Grayson salvage a spiral staircase in Norfolk, while Mike and the guys pick through a restoration shop in Petersburg.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.sub-title: Salvaging Items From a Foursquare Farmhouse in Roanoke, Va
programme.desc: The Black Dog Salvage crew take on a foursquare farmhouse in Roanoke, Virginia.

programme.title: Ed Stafford: First Man Out
programme.desc: Ed Stafford risks his life facing off Max Djenohan, a young elite fighter on a quest to test his own capabilities, in Northern Kenyas volcanic barrier.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys attempt to rescue a family descended from rocknroll royalty by reclaiming their homestead from the jungle on Kauai. But when a dangerous flash flood strikes, the Raneys find themselves on the wrong side of the river and out of time.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: In Germany, Mike and Elvis are captivated by an E30 M3, their most expensive purchase yet. Will their efforts make this M3 shine enough for buyers?

programme.title: How the Universe Works

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Paul wants to buy a Citroen DS, but Drew has major reservations. This banged up classic car is priced at £6,500- will the guys take it on?

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Today, Henry and his ace mechanic mate Sam Lovegrove are in Surrey where they find Pontiac ambulances, mysterious automotive sculptures, and strangely well preserved motorbikes. Later, in Cornwall, they meet a collector whose cottage is like a transport museum, chock full with memorabilia, penny farthings and lights of all description.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great New Year Bake Off
programme.desc: In the fourth series, the search for Britains best amateur baker is back as 12 passionate baking fans compete for the title. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins return as presenters, as do judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who devise the three challenges faced by the competitors each week. They incorporate a signature bake, which tests the bakers personality and creative flair; a technical bake, which tests experience; and a showstopper bake, during which the bakers are able to showcase their depth of skill and talent. Berry and Hollywood inspect, prod and sample the baked goodies as they decide who gets to have their cake - and eat it.

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to West Babylon, New York to visit Classic American, a restaurant that Gordon discovers does not live up to its name. The venue is struggling with mounting debt and two inexperienced owners fighting to keep their American dream alive.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Oakhurst, New Jersey, to help Mike Farber, the overwhelmed owner of Mike and Nellies restaurant, who lost his way when Nellie, his father and business partner, died. Opened in 1996, the restaurant was a lifelong dream for the father and son. Alone at the helm, and still mourning the loss of his father, Mike has taken his eye off the ball and the restaurant has gone to pot.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Austin, Texas, home to struggling restaurant El Greco, a business in danger of imminent collapse. El Greco is owned by mother and son Athina and Jake, and claims to be an authentic Greek restaurant. Much to Gordons disgust, the duo have secretly recruited `Chef Mike the microwave to help them out on a daily basis.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon is in Atlanta, Georgia, to visit Michons, a family-run smokehouse restaurant with a future thats about to go up in smoke because of mismanagement and lazy cooking. Michons owner, Al Wilson, had always hoped that one day he would pass his beloved restaurant over to his daughter, Natalie. But when he suffered a collapsed lung, the handover came about much earlier than expected.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Philadelphia to visit a Mexican restaurant called Zocalo. At one point, this restaurant played Cupid to a young couple who met, fell in love and married while working here together. Greg and Mary Russell loved the place so much that they pooled their resources and bought it. However, it seems that Cupids arrow had a poisoned tip: the restaurant has become an albatross around their necks.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Fremont, California, to try to save a restaurant that is tearing the owners marriage apart. Saki Kavouniaris took over the failing Spin-a-Yarn restaurant in 1995 and began to turn it into a success. He fell in love with a waitress, but the restaurant and the marriage are now failing.

programme.desc: A charming super spy and his geeky scientist companion are almost exact opposites. But what the scientist lacks in social skills he makes up for in invention, creating awesome gadgets for the spy to use on his epic missions.

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: Accompanied by his slave, a Roman centurion heads to Scotlands Highlands to retrieve the long-lost Ninth Legions golden eagle standard and restore his fathers honour.

programme.title: Violent Night
programme.desc: An elite team of mercenaries break into a family compound on Christmas Eve, taking everyone hostage inside. However, they arent prepared for a surprise combatant: Santa Claus is on the grounds, and hes about to show why this Nick is no saint.

programme.title: The 355
programme.desc: CIA agent Mason "Mace" Brown joins forces with a rival German agent, a cutting-edge computer specialist and a Colombian psychologist when a top-secret weapon falls into the hands of a group of mercenaries.

programme.title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?
programme.desc: Lee Israel is a frustrated, hard-drinking author who can barely afford to pay her rent or bills in 1990s New York. Desperate for money, Israel soon hatches a scheme to forge letters by famous writers and sell them to bookstores and collectors. When the dealers start to catch on, Lee recruits a dubious friend to help her continue her self-destructive cycle of trickery and deceit.

programme.title: The Masque of the Red Death
programme.desc: Stylish chiller about the evil Prince Prospero, a medieval Italian prince, devoted to the pursuit of evil and the worship of Satan, who enjoys the high life in his eerie country castle as the Red Plague destroys the peasant population around him. Loosely adapted from two Edgar Allan Poe tales by cult director Roger Corman.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June is a wildly imaginative girl who finds herself in Wonderland -- an amusement park she created in her mind. With the park falling into disarray, she soon teams up with a group of lovable animals to try and save Wonderland before its lost forever.

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: In 17th-century England, Charles Stuart rallies a group of supporters in opposition to Oliver Cromwells Roundheads.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes: Talking Film
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Cake Wars

programme.title: Cake Wars
programme.desc: Seven teams composed of a cake artist, sugar sculptor and master food carver compete; they must tackle the worst gift under the Christmas tree; giving Santa Claus a makeover.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes inviting dishes that are perfect for a cosy winter get-together. Theres an amazing Italian Wedding Casserole, Braised Beef and Red Chilies with a rich red sauce and a simple but scrumptious Roasted Squash Soup.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Things are getting very chocolatey in Ree Drummonds kitchen. For the perfect start to the day, she makes White Chocolate and Berry Pancakes, followed by Overload Cookies with a fabulous chocolate fivesome; Spicy Cocoa Rub; Ultimate Frozen Mocha.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Rigatoni and meatballs, holiday bacon appetisers, chocolate mint brownies bites.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Its a few days before Christmas, and Ree is making Christmas goodies to give as gifts. She whips up homemade gumdrops, Christmas cherries, pretzel turtles, cayenne cheese straws and sweet spicy smoky roasted almonds.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond has money-saving ideas for transforming random cuts of beef into four delicious dishes, including slow cooker Sunday stew, teriyaki beef stir-fry, meat pies and grilled beef salad.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Home: Dressed Up for the Holidays
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates the holidays with extra special seasonal eats. For brunch, theres next-level impressive Smoked Salmon Benedict, elegant Creamy Mushroom Soup thats party perfect and an amped-up side dish of Hasselback Sweet Potatoes.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass
programme.desc: Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood take us through stunning recipes that all the family can make during the festive season. Mary kicks off with a Pavlova wreath and Paul makes a Chelsea bun Christmas tree. Mary makes a decadent trifle layered with fruit compote and Paul puts leftovers to irresistible use.

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: James Martin gets ahead for Christmas, providing lots of clever tips and tricks to save time and stress on the big day. He is joined by Sir Michael Parkinson.

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: James Martin shows how to make impressive puds, Christmas Eve suppers and magnificent mains, and is joined by Helen Skelton.

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: James Martin brings together a classic collection of festive recipes to satisfy comfort food cravings. He is joined by Michel Roux Senior.

programme.title: Holiday Baking Championship
programme.desc: Jesse Palmer tasks the bakers with turning beautiful holiday designs into mini-tart mosaics. The bakers make merry and bright double-barrel wrapping paper cakes that feel like the perfect gift for judges Carla Hall, Duff Goldman and Nancy Fuller.

programme.title: Guys Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri has the chefs turn a savoury classic, ravioli, into a holiday favourite, before challenging the remaining chefs to make a decadent chocolate dessert using sample ingredients stationed around the market.

programme.title: Christmas Cookie Challenge
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and Eddie Jackson invite four cookie-making couples to make two Christmas gift tags - one for each of them. The pairs construct a fortress fit to withstand a snowball fight with a ready pile of snowballs in hopes of winning $10,000.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Christmas Countdown
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver offers a stress-free guide to festive feasting with his foolproof masterplan for turkey, stuffing and roast spuds, groovy veggie sides and, of course, fantastic gravy.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Country House at Christmas
programme.desc: When it comes to Christmas food and entertaining, Britains country houses have always put on a show. Mary Berry visits Harewood House in Yorkshire to meet its army of skilled staff and dedicated volunteers as they prepare the house for Christmas. With its Robert Adam interiors, Chippendale furniture and Capability Brown gardens, Harewood is one of the nations most beautiful stately homes.

programme.desc: Taking inspiration from all over Europe for the festive season, Mary and Paul put a twist on British Christmas favourites. Paul kicks off the baking with St Lucia buns, and Mary makes a white chocolate and stem ginger cheesecake.

programme.title: Cake Boss: Next Great Baker

programme.title: Christmas Cookie Challenge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is a highly emotional day for one of the chefs as he prepares a dish which is inspired by and a tribute to his own great Briton, his late grandfather. But all is not going to plan and the chef ends up making one key element three times in a bid to achieve perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs are cooking for judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton for the very first time. Joining them as guest judge is John Williams MBE, the executive head chef at The Ritz, the only hotel to hold a royal warrant for banqueting.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is Chris McGowans third time however, he is facing tough competition from Mark Abbott, head chef at Daniel Cliffords 2 Michelin star restaurant, Midsummer House, and also from Eddie Attwell who has just completed a year as head chef at Ardtara Country House in Upperlands.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mark Abbott is pushing himself again plating up a complex fish course of the very finest produce. He is calling it Shellsational but at the last minute he forgets a key element. Returning chef Chris McGowan is refining cod and chips and Eddie Attwell is getting classical with the king of the sea, turbot.The repartee is relentless as the chefs jostle for top place on the leader board. Once again there is plenty of emotion as the veteran chef delivers the scores.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and returning Chef Chris McGowan is feeling confident but part of his dish involves making his own venison sausages to serve with a venison rack, and getting it all done in time is straining his emotions. Eddie Attwell is also serving the meat but with a traditional Northern Irish dish called Dock pudding. Mark Abbott is pushing himself again, he is using wagyu beef and serving it with tongue and corn cooked in a variety of ways.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for a historic score, he could beat his boss - a veteran of GBM - and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, restaurant critic and Editor-at-Large of the Independent, Amol Rajan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to Londons Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This years challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queens historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth lls Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs arrive at the Palace of Westminster to cook for the Banquet of Great Britons. The chefs have been selected because their dishes showcase contemporary British cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during the Queens historic reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their summery starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, Executive Chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks with when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to tomorrows regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. Theyre hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges: nd for the first time this year, broadcaster and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybodys favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and with a seafood specialist in the kitchen the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping hell be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home
programme.desc: David meets his newest winners in the semi-rural countryside of the border between New York and Canada; despite the winter chill, theyre looking forward to the summers as they search for a home with country charm and a pool.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Another unprecedented case with the first ever celebrity searcher - KT Tunstall - as she tries to find her birth father. Also, featuring two siblings searching for the birth mother they were separated from in the 1960s against a backdrop of social prejudice toward single mothers. Singer KT Tunstall always knew she was adopted. She grew up in St Andrews, Scotland and had a happy childhood with a loving adoptive family.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Including a foundlings incredible journey to Hong Kong in search of information about her origins, and a daughters desperate quest to fulfil her mothers dying wish. Abandoned in Hong Kong as a baby, all Claire Martin knows is that she arrived at Heathrow Airport in December 1962, and was adopted by a British couple.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: A recent graduate accepts a dream job in Laurel and now shes ready to buy a house; shes known for hosting great parties and wants to entertain, but she has a surprise requirement for Ben and Erin that will be a major factor in the home she chooses.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Another British couple decide to swap the grey skies of Britain for sun, sea and sand abroad.

programme.title: Building Alaska
programme.desc: Jeff Erickson takes on a challenging cliff side build. Chappie Cooks team struggles to get materials to the site without roads. First-time builder Chris Sewell faces some harsh realities about his foundation.

programme.title: Flip or Flop
programme.desc: Tarek and Christina return to the street of a previous flip in Cypress, California, when they cant agree on a design for the kitchen, they decide to settle matters with a quick game of hoops.

programme.title: Flip or Flop
programme.desc: Tarek and Christina buy a tri-level house in Irvine, California, sight unseen. After opening up the tiny kitchen and updating the master bedroom, theres still a lot to do with a shrinking budget.

programme.title: The Boys of H Company
programme.desc: The battle of Iwo Jima cost the lives of nearly 6,000 US marines. Follow astonishing stories of some of the young, inexperienced warriors who fought for control of the tiny volcanic island.

programme.title: Operation Carpetbagger: The Secret Mission to End World War II
programme.desc: Chronicling Operation Carpetbagger, one of the most top-secret missions of World War II.

programme.title: Barbarossa: The Lost Diaries
programme.desc: Lieutenant Sander undertakes an arduous journey to Leningrad, revealing the harsh German east campaign of Operation Barbarossa. He notes down his experiences in a diary that provides us a look at the attack on the Soviet Union.

programme.title: Barbarossa: The Lost Diaries
programme.desc: Lieutenant Sander undertakes an arduous journey to Leningrad, revealing the harsh German east campaign of Operation Barbarossa. He notes down his experiences in a diary that provides us a look at the attack on the Soviet Union.

programme.title: Bombing Germany and the Battle of the Atlantic
programme.desc: Veterans recall their experiences in the 1945 skies over Germany and the Battle of the Atlantic.

programme.title: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: A look at how mechanised warfare aided Germanys advance into France; a look at the way commando raids, blitzkrieg, mobile desert warfare, and amphibious landings changed warfare.

programme.title: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: The battles of World War II increase in sheer size of the forces involved as well as the power of their weapons; a look inside Germanys strategies for Operation Barbarossa, as they attempt to invade the Soviet Union.

programme.title: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: A wide variety of strategies are needed during World War II, as battles are fought in every continent in many different landscapes; the English are cut-off at Dunkirk following unstoppable Nazis tearing through Western Europe.

programme.title: Battles Won and Lost
programme.desc: In every battle lies victory and defeat, decided by strategy and which side is better able to manage resources. The battles won and lost determine the outcome of World War II.

programme.title: Hitler: The Rise To Power

programme.title: Undermining the Nazis: Paris Secret Tunnels

programme.title: Nazi Fugitives
programme.desc: The Nazi regime lasted from 1933 to 1945 and was one of the most horrific periods of history. However, Adolf Hitler was not working alone. He had a circle of some of the most barbaric men alongside him, who helped make the atrocities possible.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: What persuaded one-time "Man of the Year" Pierre Laval to send Jews to the death camps?

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: Uncovers the motives behind the people and organisations who made the choice to aid the Nazi war effort.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: Viktor Arajs formed a Latvian commando unit that hunted Jews.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: If Leon Degrelle, a writer and journalist, had lived in another era, then he could have been a hero and a leader. However, he became a supporter of Hitler and ended up betraying his faith, his country and his people.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: Croat Dinko Sakic ran an extermination camp in Axis-occupied Yugoslavia.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: The story of Vidkun Quisling, who declared himself Fuhrer of occupied Norway.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators
programme.desc: While the IRA never shared fascist ideology, a number of members traded intelligence with Abwehr as they sought an end to British rule in Ireland.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River Hunters sees Rick and river-searching expert Beau searching the unexplored rivers and waterways of Britain, unearthing treasures from the past which reveal how our various ancestors used to live.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: The team find evidence from one of Scotlands bloodiest eras as they wade through the waters of the River Garry in the Scottish Highlands, the site of the first major clash between Highland Jacobites and the government army.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Rick Edwards and Beau Ouimette embark upon an epic search through the River Ouse, which winds its way through North Yorkshire, in a bid to find evidence that it was once home to Viking life.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice discovers the well-preserved writing tablets, swords and domestic items left by Romans at Vindolanda during a time of British rebellion. On the Scottish island of Iona, there are traces of a long-lost monastery and pilgrimage site that was originally built by the legendary Saint Columba, and has been compared to Jerusalem. In the east of Scotland, a weapons hoard belonging to a wealthy Bronze Age warrior is unearthed.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: A look at the biggest collection of Roman writing tablets in Britain, giving insight into what Roman London was really like. Off the coast of Kent, a dive into the English Channel reveals the biggest marine excavation since the Mary Rose, an 18th-century East India Company ship packed with silver.

programme.title: Digging for Britain

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In this special, Professor Alice Roberts reveals the forgotten story of the Roman Armys secret weapon in Britain - their cavalry. These fearsome horsemen were the key to defending Britains most famous Roman monument fortification, Hadrians Wall.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts celebrates the biggest and best archaeological discoveries of 2018 from the north of the UK, starting with a prehistoric Pompeii at the Black Loch of Myrton.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: We join a team as they undertake the largest maritime investigation since the Mary Rose and reveal the extraordinary story of HMS Invincible.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Stone Age Engineering and Battle of Bullecourt
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts explores 2018s best archaeological finds from the east of the UK: a monument as old as Stonehenge, a dig at the site of Britains first tank battle, and some disturbing Roman burials.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts follows the excavation of Iron Age Britains most spectacular grave. A team of archaeologists in East Yorkshire have uncovered the remains of only the third upright chariot burial ever found in Britain.

programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts explores 2019s most exciting archaeological finds.

programme.title: Digging for Britain

programme.title: Digging for Britain

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The team are on the hunt for archaeology from the more recent past as they follow the search for artefacts from World War II. They join marine archaeologists in the Solent as they raise the once-in-a-lifetime find of a Fairey Barracuda divebomber. More than 2,500 Barracudas were in service during the war but not a single complete plane survives today. Naoíse Mac Sweeney joins the post excavation to reveal how the find could help bring this rare aircraft back to life.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in Burnely in Lancashire, a bungalow on a big plot in Paddock Wood in Kent and a semi in Chaddesden in Derby all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A large barn in Upwell in Norfolk, a period property in Folkestone in Kent and a house in Chesterton in Newcastle-under-Lyme are all in need of major TLC.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy look around a trio of terraces in Stoke, Whitstable in Kent and the former mining village of Penrhiwceiber in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two friends who buy a house in Cumbrias Maryport discover a bonus room they never knew existed. Elsewhere developers tackle a terraced house in Burton-upon-Trent, while in Deal in Kent an ambitious redevelopment of an ambulance hall gets under way.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A mid-terrace house near Birmingham, a flat in Londons vibrant Maida Hill and a bit of land in Scotlands historic Dunfermline catch the attention of property developers who have grand ideas - but will they go according to plan?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former railway workers cottage in Feniton in Devon, a terraced house in Cobridge in Stoke and a former Methodist chapel in Somercotes in Derbyshire are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a house in Congleton in Cheshire, a one bedroom flat in Willesden in London and a former ambulance station in Port Talbot in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An enormous semi in Rotherham, an impressive former chapel in Fraddon in Cornwall and a tiny terraced house in Putney in London go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy looks at a one-bedroom flat next to a train line in London with a hefty guide price, while Martin meets a father and son team working on a two-bedroom terrace in Abertillary. He also visits a pair of semis in Walderslade in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy meets a primary school teacher with a basement flat in East Dulwich in London, while Martin meets property developers in Ebbw Vale in Wales and Workington in Cumbria - both of whom have ambitious plans for kitchens and bathrooms.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Its a family affair for all three property projects in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford. A father and daughter, cousins and a father and his two stepsons tackle projects bought at auction from just over £20,000 to more than £1.2 million.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy enjoys a day by the seaside visiting a two bedroom maisonette a few steps from the water in Kents Leysdown-on-Sea, while Martin has a look at a terraced house in Cymmer in the Welsh Valleys and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Penkhull near Stoke.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin looks around a terraced house in West Bromwich and another in Telford, while Lucy checks on progress 18-months after she first visited a bungalow on a large plot near Gillingham in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a two-bedroom flat in Budleigh Salterton and a three-bed terrace in Downpatrick, Northern Ireland, which needs a new lease of life. Lucy meets the buyer of a plot of land in Abbey Wood, London, who has big plans for its future.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy catches up with a developer she met three years ago. This time he has an ambitious project turning two flats in a Victorian house in Hounslow into three. Martin meets two first-time developers working on projects in Glasgow and Tipton.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A flat in Edinburgh, a 1930s terraced house packed full with original features in Bromley in Kent and a five-bedroom house in Exeter in danger of falling down are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A smart looking terrace with an expensive problem to fix in Pontygwaith in Wales, a large Victorian house in Okehampton in Devon and an old pub in Sittingbourne in Kent all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a listed shop in Hodnet in Shropshire and a property developer working on a maisonette in Ferndale in South Wales. Lucy follows a five-year project to restore a 17th-century listed building in Margate in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy go flat-tastic looking around buildings which developers hope will create around a dozen flats. The properties sold under the hammer are in Stoke in Staffordshire, Bexleyheath in Kent and Gunnislake in Cornwall.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A five-bedroom house in Plymouth, a two-bed Victorian cottage in Croydon and a former coach house in Cardiff are sold under the hammer. Martin and Lucy meet the developers to hear about their plans to make the most of their auction buys.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are sampling the local cider at Midsomer Abbas spring fair when the body of a missing tax inspector is found floating in the cider vat. programme.title: The Road to Coronation Street
programme.desc: December 9th 1960. Granada Studios, Manchester. This is the epic story of one mans struggle to make a program that no one wanted.

programme.desc: Round 14 of the 2025 World Rally Championship is the WRC Rally Saudi Arabia - based out of Jeddah, the event introduces a unique blend of open desert speed and rocky technicality. programme.title: FIA World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 14 of the 2025 World Rally Championship is the WRC Rally Saudi Arabia - based out of Jeddah, the event introduces a unique blend of open desert speed and rocky technicality. The roads are smooth and fast in places, but they quickly shift to rougher and more abrasive terrain where caution becomes key - this is a brand-new challenge for crews and engineers alike with limited data and no established formbook.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy goes to the Australian outback to try to catch the rare and fearsome freshwater sawfish, which can measure up to 18 feet long. Jeremy roams the beguiling landscape and encounters scientists and a real-life Crocodile Dundee before finally confronting the disturbing truth.

programme.title: The Krays: The Myth Behind the Legend
programme.desc: Rivals and other contemporaries discuss gangsters Ronnie and Reggie Kray, who ran Londons East End.

programme.title: Britains Forgotten Serial Killer
programme.desc: This is the chilling but little-known story of Trevor Hardy, the serial killer known as the `Beast of Manchester who murdered three teenage girls between December 1974 and March 1976.

programme.title: Dying Out Loud
programme.desc: Female prisoners explain how they got to be facing life without parole, even though theyre innocent.

programme.title: Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This feature-length film examines Aileens harrowing life, tracing her story from the freezing woods of Michigan to the steamy swamps of Florida, and features her closest friends, her lawyers and even her estranged birth mother. At the heart of the film are the astonishing, unique, troubled interviews Broomfield filmed with Wuornos in prison, including her last, defiant words before execution.

programme.title: Manson
programme.desc: A chronicle of Charles Mansons life leading up to the orchestration of the Tate an LaBianca murders.

programme.title: NCR: Not Criminally Responsible
programme.desc: An investigation of the impact of the mental disorder defense in Canada.

programme.title: American Trial: The Eric Garner Story
programme.desc: Real-life prosecutors and defence attorneys conduct an unscripted mock trial against the NYPD officer who was videotaped using a chokehold on Eric Garner in 2014, using the actual evidence, witnesses, expert testimony and rules of criminal procedure.

programme.title: British Gangsters: Faces of the Underworld
programme.desc: Bernard OMahoney meets Glasgows first godfather of crime, Walter Norval, the former leader of the XYY gang.

programme.title: British Gangsters: Faces of the Underworld
programme.desc: Bernie chats with three of the members of the Quality Street Gang: Jimmy the Weed Donnelly, Arthur Donnelly and Terry Barlow.

programme.title: British Gangsters: Faces of the Underworld
programme.desc: The famous ports wealthy history has contributed to the prosperous underworld within, where the likes of Charlie Seiga, Curtis Warren and Shaun Smith thrived.

programme.title: British Gangsters: Faces of the Underworld
programme.desc: We meet Billy Robinson, a man who recruited every top villain and fighter in Newcastle to work as doormen.

programme.title: Gangster No. 1: The Freddie Foreman Story
programme.desc: Attached to almost every unsolved gangland murder in London over the last 50 years, Freddie Foreman is the `Godfather of Britains criminal underworld. Foreman reveals the audacious details of the heists, double crossings, shootouts, murders and betrayals he was involved in, and ultimately, what has made him `Gangster Number.1.

programme.title: Trevor McDonald and the Killer Nurse
programme.desc: Trevor McDonald investigates the case of serial child killer Beverley Allitt and reflects on how it was reported at the time. A combination of archive from the time, interviews with victims and expert analysis will piece together this tragic and shocking story.

programme.title: Murderous Minds: Harold Shipman
programme.desc: Harold Shipman was an English general practitioner and serial killer. He is considered to be one of the most prolific serial killers in modern history, with an estimated 250 victims.

programme.title: Aileen Wuornos: The Selling of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Nick Broomfield explores the media circus surrounding the case of Americas first textbook female serial killer.

programme.title: The Boneyard
programme.desc: Chilling documentary charting a brutal real life tale of kidnapping, enslavement and murder. Find out how investigators tracked down a malicious murderer and explore the extensive trial that followed.

programme.title: Manic: Cult Leader, Scam Artists, Prophet and Father Of Fifteen
programme.desc: Kalina Bertin sets out to find the truth about their father - cult leader and scam artist.

programme.title: Animal Armoury
programme.desc: Bears, owls, and tigers use their sharp claws to fight and catch prey, while baboons, wolves and woodchucks use their teeth as weapons.

programme.title: Animal Armoury
programme.desc: The electric catfish and electric ray use shocks to attack their victims, while elephants and kangaroos fight with their feet.

programme.title: Golden Eagles: Witnesses to a Changing West
programme.desc: Eagles in Wyoming face climate change, sprawl, lead, energy threats; rehab and tribal ties aid them.

programme.title: In the Land of the Moose
programme.desc: At the end of the summer, a moose finds herself alone in the forest. She has just lost her calf, probably to a bear. Now she must find a mate. Once pregnant again, she will endure months of bone-chilling winter until she delivers in the spring.

programme.title: Ibex: Acrobats on the Rocks
programme.desc: Witness the ibex Buck, one of the most iconic animals of the European Alpine peaks, and his full life cycle.

programme.title: The Gentle Bear Man of Emo
programme.desc: Michael finds that the bonds he forges with the bears and other wild animals that live on his property in Emo, Ontario, helped heal his soul after a tragedy. His relationship with the animals put him on a path to love and redemption.

programme.title: Face to Face With the Polar Bear
programme.desc: Twin polar bear cubs struggle to survive on a Norwegian fjord when complications arise from the rapidly warming summertime conditions.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Snowy Mountains wild horses adapt to predators, neighbors, and harsh but nourishing conditions.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Australias wild horses adapt to threats, using inherited knowledge to survive harsh conditions.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Dingoes rely on teamwork and social roles to raise pups and survive harsh Australian winters.

programme.title: Animal Armoury
programme.desc: Colouring that matches or blends with their surroundings helps the Arctic fox, green tree frog and penguin hide from predators.

programme.title: Animal Armoury
programme.desc: Many animals such as toads, moths, snakes and spiders have poison glands, while the spines of the stone fish and the scorpion fish are poisonous.

programme.title: Jaguar: King of the Jungle
programme.desc: The jaguar is the third largest of the big cats, and pound for pound, the most powerful. This jaguar patrols a home range of over 100 square kilometers in Brazil, deep in the heart of the worlds largest tropical rainforest.

programme.title: Lions: Africas Super Power
programme.desc: The endless plains of East Africa is a paradise for lions. The most social of all cats, lions form prides that are unlike any other animals. Together, theyll hunt, raise their young and defend their territory.

programme.title: Wild Galapagos
programme.sub-title: In the Grip of the Ocean
programme.desc: The reef life, and the birds, lizards and reptiles that cope with the lava rock islands of the Galapagos, make this remote series of islands a unique natural habitat.

programme.title: Wild Galapagos
programme.desc: The Galapagos Islands are home to animals that have made adaptations, including penguins, iguanas, tortoises, cormorants and - possibly the oddest - the vampire finch.

programme.title: The Real Lost World
programme.desc: The inspiration for Sir Arthur Conan Doyles "The Lost World," the mysterious jungle plateau, Roraima.

programme.title: Bucket List South America
programme.desc: From record-breaking mountain ranges to massive rainforests, the variety of landscapes supports a seemingly endless diversity of wildlife.

programme.title: Vanishing Dragons
programme.desc: This film investigates the decline in marine iguanas and tries to determine what can stop their extinction.

programme.title: Secrets of the Great White Shark
programme.desc: Studying the history of the great white shark, alongside their anatomy and how theyve helped the oceans for hundreds of millions of years. However, in the modern age they face extinction as over 1,000 million sharks are killed every year.

programme.title: Pink Floyd: The Story of Wish You Were Here
programme.desc: New interviews with Roger Waters, David Gilmour and Nick Mason tell the fascinating story of the making of Pink Floyds landmark 1975 album Wish You Were Here.

programme.title: Bee Gees: In Our Own Time
programme.desc: Following the story of the Bee Gees, one of the most successful bands of all time. This is the story of three very close brothers, tied together by familial love and a natural aptitude and obsession for all things musical. Born on the Isle of Man but raised in Manchester the Brothers Gibb, eldest brother Barry and twins Robin and Maurice were whisked to Australia by their parents in search of a better life.

programme.title: Classic Christmas Movies
programme.desc: The Muppet Christmas Carol: Film Critics Ian, Stephen Armstrong, Neil Norman and Christina Newland discuss the legendary Dickens story and the iconic charm of The Muppets.

programme.title: Classic Christmas Movies

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: A widowed farmer, with a brave but brutal military past, decides not to join up when the British arrive in 1776. However, when his son enlists and is later captured by the enemy, the former soldier must abandon his new-found pacifist principles in order to rescue his oldest child, and forms a regiment of Carolina patriots, whose guerrilla tactics prove pivotal to the US war effort.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview

The superhero must prevent Luthors nefarious scheme to rearrange the west coast of America with the help of a couple of nuclear bombs.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after a five-year absence to find Lex Luthor ready to take over the world, and Lois Lane shacked up with a new man and a kid. The people have lost faith in their former saviour. Can Superman save their lives and regain their trust?

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Geeky highschooler Sam Witwicky buys his first-ever car, hoping it will improve his chances with Mikaela. Imagine his surprise when his beat-down Camaro transforms into an alien robot called `Bumblebee and asks for his assistance in a deadly war.

programme.title: Bad Boys: Ride or Die
programme.desc: When their late police captain gets linked to drug cartels, wisecracking Miami cops Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett embark on a dangerous mission to clear his name.

programme.title: Fast and Furious Presents: Hobbs and Shaw
programme.desc: Brixton Lorr is a cybernetically enhanced soldier who possesses superhuman strength, a brilliant mind and a lethal pathogen that could wipe out half of the worlds population. Its now up to hulking lawman Luke Hobbs and lawless operative Deckard Shaw to put aside their past differences and work together to prevent the seemingly indestructible Lorr from destroying humanity.

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Scientists, soldiers and adventurers encounter the mighty Kong and other monstrous creatures after travelling to an uncharted island in the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Terminator Salvation

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Mikaela and Sam once again join forces with Optimus Prime again to save Earth from ruthless robot The Fallen.

programme.title: Deep Sea

programme.title: Open Season 2
programme.desc: Elliots way to his wedding with Giselle gets longer when Mr Weenie is kidnapped by a group of pampered pets determined to return him to his owners.

programme.title: Buffalo Kids
programme.desc: Arriving in New York City in 1886, two orphaned Irish siblings embark on a wild cross-country journey aboard a transcontinental train. They make a new friend and encounter heroes and villains in their quest to find a new home.

programme.title: Rise of the Guardians
programme.desc: Winter sprite Jack Frost must save the day when an evil boogeyman schemes to stop the worlds children from believing in Santa Claus, the Easter Bunny and other immortal Guardians.

programme.title: Happy Feet Two
programme.desc: Mumbles son Erik hasnt yet found his talents, and he goes with his friends to Adelie-land which is ruled by a penguin who can fly. When Erik returns to Emperor-land and finds them trapped under big walls of ice. Will Erik be able to save his family and friends before it is too late?

programme.title: Open Season 3
programme.desc: After Boog switches places with a circus bear, Elliott and the gang must rescue him before the circus returns home to Russia.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: Spoiled by their upbringing and with no idea of what wildlife is really like, Alex the lion, Marty the zebra and hypochondriac giraffe Melman swap New York Central Zoo for madcap Madagascar, on a journey to find their friend.

programme.title: Happy Feet
programme.desc: Son of Memphis and Norma, little sweet penguin Mumble has a big problem: he cant sing a single note. In a world where everyone needs a heart song to attract a soul mate, Mumble feels he doesnt belong there. Our hero Mumble is the worst singer in the world, but he can tap dance brilliantly.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: A spoiled rat gets flushed down the toilet and finds himself stranded in Londons sewer underworld. A savvy scavenger helps him evade frog assassins and make his way back to his plush home.

programme.title: Mr. Peabody and Sherman
programme.desc: Mr. Peabody, the most accomplished canine in the world, and his boy, Sherman, use a time machine called the Wabac to embark on outrageous adventures. However, when Sherman takes the Wabac without permission to impress his friend Penny, he accidentally rips a hole in the universe and causes havoc with world history. Its up to Mr. Peabody to mount a rescue and prevent the past, present and future from being permanently altered. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: After an alien race called the Boov take over Earth, a resourceful human girl becomes a banished Boovs ally.

programme.title: 10 Lives
programme.desc: A pampered cat takes for granted the lucky hand he has been dealt after he is rescued and loved by Rose, a kind-hearted and passionate student. When he loses his ninth life, fate steps in to set him on a transformative journey.

programme.title: Into the Wonderwoods
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Angelo, an aspiring explorer, is left behind by his distracted parents at a rest stop. He then ventures into a forest inhabited by strange, wonderful creatures to find them.

programme.title: Buffalo Kids
programme.desc: Arriving in New York City in 1886, two orphaned Irish siblings embark on a wild cross-country journey aboard a transcontinental train. They make a new friend and encounter heroes and villains in their quest to find a new home.

programme.title: Open Season 3
